Reviews.Title: “Hotel Ibis London Excel-Docklands”
Reviews.Author: ss d
Reviews.Content: Stay here 24 March 2012 to 28 March 2012 2 hours to hotel from Hethrow airport by subway Not a pretty hotel, no spa, or place to get a facial No room service, Can't call out of hotel room with a credit card or phone card Directly beside Excel Center, A couple places to eat near by, food terrible in this area. Hotel it self appeared clean Staff friendly but overworked and overwhelmed Bed comfortable, clean sheets. 2 pillows, large window no view, not designed to open. Hotel room nothing in it except a small TV with local cable Internet service for $15 Canadian per day. Other hotels nearby offer 1/2 hr per day free Bathroom, Shower and sink, toilet clean no soap, shampoo, nothing else, 2 towels Would not stay here again, because other hotels nearby were cheaper and had free internet and restaurants, London city airport close by, can see British Airways planes flying over all day and night. Couldn't hear them inside hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing value”
Reviews.Author: rjhall
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here twice and each time have had an enjoyable stay. Functional clean room - comfy bed. Staff very friendly and helpful - the cleaning staff always smiled and spoke. Close to Royal Victoria Station (leisurely 5 minute walk)

Reviews.Title: “Try another nearby hotel”
Reviews.Author: blumberg
Reviews.Content: From a USA perspective....yes it's clean and perfectly convenient to the Excel Exhibition centre and to the tube. Compared to budget hotels in the USA such as Hampton Inn, Holiday Inn Express, Fairfield Inn, it comes in waaay behind. Don't expect ANY of the little things that you get at one of those hotels, e.g. shampoo!, facial tissues, hand or face towels, two trashcans, free tv (yes, 10 GBP per day to watch regular TV; I didn't do it). Don't bother to ask the front desk for a razor or toothpaste or plug adapter because they will be happy to point you to their vending machine or the store across the street. I was there 4 nights/5 days. I actually enjoyed the breakfast buffet (it is normally 7 GBP per day, $10+ but mine was part of the package). The "bar" beer selection was pathetic with no real english beers on tap (Carling?!) but this was not unusual around Excel Centre. People attending Excel are probably on a fixed per diem and can probably find a' better hotel nearby or a short tube ride away for the same price. If you are a tourist to London, expect at least 2 trains to get to the city center. FWIW: I travel about 70-80 days per year and have for the last 8 years on trips of usually 3-7 days length.

Reviews.Title: “Almost like a youth hostel”
Reviews.Author: CheekyKush
Reviews.Content: I was a little disappointed with this hotel. It's not much different than the custom house hotel nearby. The room was small and the bathroom tiny. However it was clean and not too expensive. If you need to be at the excel centre then the location is ideal. It has a bar which is reasonably priced. Nothing much else to say.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for Excel Centre”
Reviews.Author: Harriet E
Reviews.Content: Basic but clean as you would expect from an Ibis. Its a stone's throw from excel and the nearest DLR so very well located. breakfast is all you can eat for £7.50 so its good value if you have a good appetite! the two things i would complain about are that i booked in advance (which usually means you get the room cheaper) but on arrival at the hotel their rack rate written on the board at reception was £69 - some £30 cheaper than what i paid. My other complaint is that housekeeping opened my door before 9am and woke me up (i was leaving that day anyway so think there should be better communication between reception and housekeeping to ensure people arent woken unnecessarily.)

Reviews.Title: “Rooms as expected for the price, basic but clean but the food is rubbish”
Reviews.Author: Sandalwoods
Reviews.Content: We ate in the restaurant for the first 2 nights. On the first night the fish and chips were greasy and cold and the waitress removed my starter plate before my husband had finished his, then she served the mains while he was still eating his starter and just removed the plate. We decided to try again the next night and it was worse. Soup was like water, my starter differed considerably from the same one the night before, my husband asked for a fried egg with his gammon steak to be told there were no eggs in the hotel!!!! We waited ages for our mains (which were unedible) and we were told by the waiter it was because they were so busy, there was 5 other tables!!!! Also every wine I ordered there was none left. I would not recommend the food and the hotel needs to employ people who understand english. A very poor show for a London hotel, it felt like it was being run on a shoe string.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and cheap”
Reviews.Author: tomilo
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, we went a bit early to checkin but they managed to get us a room (another room was available later). Good restaurant, friendly staff, quite okayish breakfast (7,5 pounds). Cheap and good hotel, definitely will come again in Ibis. Nearby shops and restaurant are good also.

Reviews.Title: “good clean room”
Reviews.Author: peter1958_11
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 night,great for exel We had our evening meal in the hotel restaurant which was good for the price The room was clean and had all we needed for our stay,Breakfast was very good plenty of choice and good coffee. We would also like to say thank you to jurgita for her good,friendly service making us feel welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: laurr92
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel last february to go see neyo at 02 was nice hotel quiet and dlr just 2 second walk away staff were nice and friendly would reccomend

Reviews.Title: “Great for the 02”
Reviews.Author: JOANNE028
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently with my partner as we were going to the Brit awards at the 02.. The DLR is an three min walk away from hotel through the excel bridge... The local nisa is opposite which sells everything and does not close till 12 midnight.. The hotel itself has a 24 hour reception and also a 24 hour bar and food(restricted though) which is always manned... The buffet breakfast is only £7.50 each and well worth it .. The hotel rooms were compact but it had a kettle,televison and an hairdyer... Great...plenty of space in the showerarea and also the bed was very comfortable.. The hotel was a great budget 3 star and i only paid £50.00 a night for two midweek.. If you are needing a base down near the 02 this is a great hotel for you all

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Jones_s14 Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Clean, easy to get to, thick walls for a peaceful sleep, helpful staff and everything you could want for a stay at excel / docklands / the capital. The breakfast buffet could be a lot better and the bar area isn't very inviting but otherwise I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “The Basic Budget Hotel Ibis Excel Docklands”
Reviews.Author: EmilyAnna1990
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located a 5 minute walk from the DLR stop and good value for money . It was an ideal hotel for a concert we were attending at the 02 arena. However please check your travel arrangements prior to going (on a weekend) as on the Sunday the DLR was closed all day so we had to use replacements buses which was a bit of a hassle especially when you have no idea where the buses stop and where you have to go. The lady at reception however did inform us of how we should get to the 02 that evening so they were aware of the situation which was reassuring! We had a room on the 3rd floor over looking the docks which was lovely, the hotel was quiet inside (best to request a room away from the elevators) however you can hear the planes quite clearly as the hotel is situated below its flight path. But by paying next to nothing for the room we weren't entirely bothered! You can also hear everything in the corridor and in the rooms next door - so good luck if you have noisy neighbours! The area itself was really really quiet though.... Rooms are standard - really comfortable bed, tea and coffee facilities, Flat screen TV and a fantastic high pressure shower! Everything was clean and tidy and I couldn't fault it at all. The staff were friendly enough and efficient however we only spoke to them during checking in and checking out - both occasions were speedy. All in all good value for money, if needs be I would stay again (would double check travel arrangements prior to travelling!) however it ticks all the boxes and was a total bargain!

Reviews.Title: “as you would expect”
Reviews.Author: mberry77
Reviews.Content: I like this Ibis and stay here often when I work in London. Its near the DLR and is in a quiet area in Docklands by the Excel centre. The rooms are EXACTLY the same as any other Ibis nad sometimes the bathroom is a bit creeky as its all plastic. But the rooms are quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: gorpalm
Reviews.Content: Over-nighted here recently on a weekend, paid under £40 for the night and thought it was pretty excellent value. For that money you get a basic room, comfortable bed, aircon/heating, small tv (no freeview!), small but perfectly formed pre-fab bathroom with great water pressure. Not so pleased with the very poor sound insulation between rooms, at one point in the early evening certainly sounded like one of my near neighbours was having very vigorous and angry personal interactions with the furniture in his room. Ate in the restaurant for dinner - pretty authentic tasting curry and reasonable prices means it doesn't feel such a compromise, also London isn't exactly on your doorstep here. Overall (apart from the mercifully short period of excessive noise from the neighbour) it was a pretty decent experience, made even better of course by the low low rate.

Reviews.Title: “Good Basic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RyHol Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good Basic Hotel, no luxury, but no complaints. Slightly noisy room (701) next to lift. Not a water view as we had hoped. These are small things however - the stay was pleasant and functional so no real complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the 02”
Reviews.Author: Hambrook
Reviews.Content: Stayed a night due to going to the o2.Room was very clean and good value and the staff very good. Easy to get to the o2 from the hotel.Would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Basic”
Reviews.Author: MrWorldtravellerJ
Reviews.Content: I've stayed 3 times now purely because of the price. It hasn't changed. Still not enough electric sockets in the room, overpriced breakfast and car park is too too expensive.

Reviews.Title: “AN EXCELLENT RESULT”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A lovely experience was had by both myself and wife. We found the location ideal. The service at reception A1. The cleanliness of the room and that the room was on 7 floor - faltless. We would like to return at some time in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed”
Reviews.Author: NorfolkClare
Reviews.Content: We went to the London Boat Show at Excel and stayed at the Ibis. We wanted somewhere clean, nearby and cheap just to lay our heads at the end of a busy day. We were able to park our car in the Novotel/Ibis car park when we arrived and left it there until we left next day for just £15. The hotel was a short walk across the pedestrian area in front of the Excel building and just perfect after a day of walking around the exhibition. We paid £65 for a double en-suite room which was very clean and comfortable. My husband is a light sleeper and had a rough night's sleep as he heard every noise (every time the neighbours flushed their toilets!) but I slept like a log!! Bed was comfortable and room was warm. We didn't stay for breakfast as we had eaten well the night before and didn't want it but it looked good value for money. We ate in the Ibis restaurant in the evening which was not expensive and food was fine - but we did have to wait too long for our meal. People around us were complaining. Staff were very friendly and helpful. We would definitely stay there again for convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Gymnastics Olympic Test Event London”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very convenient for the O2 and London City Airport. The hotel was clean and the staff very friendly. We travelled by DLR and the signs from the station were very poor, Luckily I had been to the Excel centre and we walked in that general direction as we knew the the hotel was close to Excel. The hotel was very busy and on our first night 2 of the white wines on offer were out of stock and on the second night the gin ran out. Apart from this our stay was very pleasant and the hotel was clean and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, inconvenient location”
Reviews.Author: samirkhare
Reviews.Content: The hotel offers fantastic value for money stays. The hotel being a recent construction has very new unused feel to it currently. The rooms are small, as is to be expected from a budget hotel. The wireless connectivity is a challenge in some rooms, so please check that out before accepting the room keys - else you will end up sitting in the lobby with your laptop / ipad. The front desk staff is young, but very enthusiastic and helpful. The hotel location is a bit of an inconvenience as the nearest tube station is about a 3 minute walk (Royal Victoria) and trains from here will involve at least a couple of changes if you want to get to any of the London city major stops. Specially as an international traveller with early morning flights, you may end up shelling something like 70 to 80 pounds for a cab to Heathrow. There is a fair bit of construction going around the hotel on account of the proximity to the 2012 Olympics areas. Not a great choice of eateries around the hotel, so plan a tube trip of at least 1 station (Canning town) to get to good eateries. Though, the walkway next to the hotel on the banks of the river is very serene and is next to the cleaner parts of the Thames.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: Topcat1980
Reviews.Content: I stayed here twice in 2011 with friends when we travelled to London for concerts/events, and would definately go back again. The rooms are clean, and have everything you need for a nights stay. I find the bathrooms a little weird - a bit like staying on a space ship or something, but they are also clean and well appointed. This hotel also seems to have some great rooms for people with special requirements (eg sight/hearing impaired) The downstairs restaurant/bar is reasonably priced for a London hotel, and the food and breakfast is good. The hotel is located in a clean and quiet area of the Docklands, right on the riverbank and a stones throw from the O2 (which is only 2 stops on the DLR/tube) and Canary Wharf. The nearest DLR is approx 2 min walk, and there is a convenience store across the road. If you are after a luxurious, elegant hotel, then don't stay here. If you are after excellent value, a clean room and a good nights sleep then this is the place for you. It's easy to find and now a firm favourite among my group of friends. We will stay here again when we book our next concert

Reviews.Title: “Bargain hotel!”
Reviews.Author: shazkowalski
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with spacious rooms and good location. Five minute walk to the dlr and a lovely bar within the hotel. The breakfast was lovely and very reasonable, all in all we were impressed!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vixen2278
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in November 2011 for a Christmas shopping trip. Hotel is close to the DLR and the O2 arena can be seen nearby. The hotel reception is very clean however none of the reception staff spoke good English so a little disappointing. The rooms were very basic with an "airline" style bathroom but again very clean. Breakfast was very good and plenty of choice each morning but the food in the restaurant and the bar was poor. The first night I had roast chicken and it was cold in the middle. On the second night we ate in the bar, I had a tuna sarnie and it was so runny I couldnt even taste the tuna!!! Overall I would recommend this as a base for touring London and would probably return but it is not a holiday hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: clairebear16
Reviews.Content: Myself and my boyfriend stayed at this hotel a few weeks back as we were attending an event at the O2 Arena. We were a few hours early for check-in but didn't want to carry our bags around London all day so thought we would leave them at the hotel. There was actually a room available and we were allowed to check-in early. This was fantastic as we had been travelling for a few hours to get there. It meant we didn't have to go the whole way to the hotel before the concert - we could go straight there from the pub we were in in the city! Staff were extremely helpful and friendly in the hotel. We did not eat there so cannot comment on the food. There were 2 downsides - first, there was a terrible smell coming up through the toilet in the room. We didn't complain as we didn't notice until we were in the room after the concert (too late to do anything about it). We just kept the toilet lid closed and it was ok but it was pretty horrid! Also, a lot of people staying at the hotel that night were at the same concert. We got a taxi back after it so were there early. After about half an hour people started coming in that had taken the train back. There were about 30 /40 very thirsty people at the bar and only one girl to serve them! People were getting very irritated! The girl was fantastic but the hotel should have had more staff available to help out. A manager stood for about 10mins watching her before trying to help serve. Overall this is a great hotel right next to the Excel Centre, a short journey to the O2 and Central London. Rooms were clean and spacious and good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “excellent rapoprt qualité prix pour londres...”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Accueil parfait en français, chambre au top, services et renseignements adequat. Un peu à l'écart du centre vile mais ce n'est pas plus mal. La ligne DLR (RER parisien sans l'odeur mais avec la sécurité, on l'a pris jusqu'à 23h sans pbs!) est à 3 min à pied et 30 min de l'hyper centre avec liaison metro... parfait pour se balader la journée et etre tranquille le soir!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, but a little crowded”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel is some way from central London, the centre is easily reached from the nearby Docklands Light Railway station. Being right neext to the Excel exhibition centre, it has an obvious attraction for people visiting exhibitions. It is a very modern hotel, with free wifi and very comfortable rooms, but the restaurant is far too small to cope with what seemed like hundreds of people all coming down for breakfast at the same time. On the night I stayed, there were several coach parties also staying, and of course they all need to be leaving at the same time, which results in a very crowded restaurant at breakfast time. That apart, the value for money is excellent. It is impossible to find a hotel of this standard anywhere in London for a similar price ( I paid only £49 for my room, which is an absolute bargain). Admittedly that was on a Friday night in mid-December, and it might be a very different price in the middle of a major exhibition, but it is very definitely worth more than £49. 9 out of 10 - only the breakfast crowds cost it the extra point.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: toddy0011 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Positives: i) Room only cost me £35. ii) 24 hr bar iii) Room furnishings adequate iv) Nice view over river Negatives: i) Couldn't find my booking in the system, even upon receipt of my booking confirmation email. ii) No soap in bathroom. iii) 2 HUGE hairs in the shower. Horrid. iv) Rock hard bed. v) As it's in the docklands, I would only recommend staying at this hotel if you were visiting the Excel Centre (100m away). Quite a trek into central London.

Reviews.Title: “Beats other standard hotels !!”
Reviews.Author: MunichLozz-e
Reviews.Content: ...by that I mean, it was the first time I stayed at an Ibis and compared to places like Travelodge, Premier Inn, etc it is worth paying the extra pennies for the little extras in this class of hotel. For example, when I stayed here at the beginning of December 2011 I had a room directly opposite the lifts on the second floor. As I soon as I closed my room door, I heard nothing ..no noise at all from the comings/goings in and out of them. Whilst the room carpets are rough and practical, I was impressed with the bathroom/toilet set-up and how it was encased in it's own pod. Was kept clean and felt clean. Additionally, I found the beds to be big enough for a big chap like me and very comfortable indeed. The compact wardrobe/shelf unit in the corner was also very useful. On the downside, I would avoid the breakfasts and also the wifi provider 'orange' whose service whilst I was there was very very poor. There is the option to use the Ibis cabled internet which comes with TV/Film extras but that is more pricey. I didn't use it so I cannot comment on this service. The staff at the bar and reception were friendly and helpful. Both areas can get pretty busy so patience is required. During my stay the whole world seemed to be staying there !!! All in all, I would try Ibis again if I come back to London for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Oh two”
Reviews.Author: martinr56
Reviews.Content: Great for O 2 , good advance rate , breakfast best avoided .Friendly, good vfm

Reviews.Title: “very good good pric/quality”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Next to DLR station, clean room and hotel, fast check-in, good value for money, very quite at night which is a pluspoint. Breakfast in weekends from 0630 till 1200 ! The bar was MUCH to noisy and felt like a local town pub...

Reviews.Title: “london trip”
Reviews.Author: buster311960 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Ideal location right next to EXCEL and train station. Very easy to travel into city centre. The rooms were clean and spacious and the memory matress ensured a good night sleep. Would recommend the buffet breakfast. We had drinks at the bar and and a meal and the price was very reasonable. The only downside was paying £15 to park at the Novotel next door. All in all though very good value for money. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a pleasant experiance”
Reviews.Author: Woody023
Reviews.Content: I had booked this hotel in August for a on night stay on th 22nd of November 2011.We arrived at the hotel at 1230hrs but was informed that our room would not be ready until 1330hrs.We asked if we could leave our case and check in about midnight after attending a concert at the Royal Albert Hall.This was agreed and the receptionist reassured us that our room would be waiting for us.We arrived back at the hotel just gone midnight.The receptionist fetched our case.I gave our booking details and was informed that we were not booked in to stay at the hotel even though I had a copy of the booking confirmation which I gave to the receptionist.He then looked at the reservation system tand informed me that the booking had been cancelled at 1530hrs that day.We were very angry at this and was also informed that the hotel was full.They did manage to get us another room in another hotel but that was not the point.Whilst we were waiting at the desk for this to be sorted another customer came in to be informed that the same thing has happened to him.I have written a complaint but to date (8th December 2011)no responce.I have written again twodays ago and still no responce.Needless to say I will not be using Ibis Hotels again which I have used many times in the past both in this country and abroad.

Reviews.Title: “Bargain for 02 stay”
Reviews.Author: IcecoldPinacolada
Reviews.Content: Second time we have used this hotel for a trip to the 02 arena. Just £59 for the room. Clean, friendly staff and good brekky. One stop up the jubilee line then one stop along the dlr and your back from the 02. Brilliant!!!

Reviews.Title: “perfect for the Excel”
Reviews.Author: lmg1358 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an ideal budget hotel for the excel, also good for the 02.The staff were very helpful and courteous, at the reception, bar and restaurant. The drinks were well proiced for London not to steep. Tea and coffee and hairdryers in the rooms, but only a shower towel each, no hand towel, only a little thing but one that you get used to. You only have to turn right out of the hotel and you are just a few minutes walk from the Excel centre, also the tube is only a short walk away in the other direction. There are two convenience shops just up the road, very handy if you've forgotten anything.

Reviews.Title: “Excellence on a budget”
Reviews.Author: CMacLaw
Reviews.Content: The Ibis ExCeL is as it says, budget, but I have stayed in a range of hotels from budget to 5*, and this is by far the best budget hotel I have stayed in, it is on par with the Premier Inn hotels which are of course, an above budget brand. The location is great, with the DLR a couple of minutes walk and convenience stores across the road. The service is always friendly and available 24/7. The rooms are basic but quite spacious and have a kettle and TV, enough to suit your room needs. Having given the thumbs up for service and location, I'm afraid the same can't be said for the dinning experience, the food is below par, even if it is budget it should be of higher quality than it it is, it's also over priced for a budget hotel, but don't let this put you off the hotel itself, there are a few good places to eat and drink locally, and a short journey on the DLR will open up more possibilities, for a good local restaurant/bar try the Fox@ExCeL. So to sum up, great hotel, great location, great service, just chose your dinning experience carefully.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for the ExCeL”
Reviews.Author: JK_LoveTravelling
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel as we were going to the Top Gear Live event at the ExCeL. So glad we did. It is literally less than a 2 minute walk to the exhibition centre. Right by the Thames and we had a view over the river and the O2 arena - looks brilliant at night when lit up. Talking of the room, it was not the biggest of hotel rooms but it was clean and warm, the bathroom had quite a big shower for a hotel and the bed was really comfortable. Buffet breakfats was reasonably priced and plenty of choice. The DLR station is a 5 min stroll away and you are in the centre of the city in 20-30 mins. If you are going to the ExCeL, no better hotel for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Good value combined with excellent Excel location”
Reviews.Author: JanaWilliams
Reviews.Content: Absolute excellent location for visitors of Excel. typical Ibis rooms. No frills but clean and practical.

Reviews.Title: “Value for London”
Reviews.Author: forest04
Reviews.Content: This is a budget hotel, so the rooms were small but adequate as a sleeping place as we were out all day. Reception very helpful about transport links and taxi service. The room was very quiet and beds comfortable. Storage space limited but adequate for a few nights. Everything compact like a caravan. Shower was great, the easiest power shower to operate that I have experienced. Transport to 02 was easy, 1 stop on DLR (station nearby) and then 1 stop on tube.

Reviews.Title: “Food poisoning so beware!”
Reviews.Author: 186411Hubbyandme
Reviews.Content: First of all will start with the positives - good location, clean (but small) room, good for what we paid (£59.00 for 2 people), friendly (but hard to communicate with due to the language barrier) staff as they were all foreign which I am not slating but they only seemed to say a scripted language to us and when asked for further info they did not seem to understand! Now onto the negatives: warm room - turned down the temperature on the thermastat to no avail. We decided to eat in the restaurant that evening as it seemed reasonably priced. My fish platter was OK although the tuna was hard and rubbery. The potato rosti most definitely from a packet. I had to opt for the fish platter after they said they had no lasagna left. My hubby had chicken. After eating some of it he realised that something was wrong with it, it was very dry and looked to have been simply reheated, so he refrained from eating it. The waitress collected our plates & never asked what was wrong. Lo and behold he came down with food poisoning! Awful way to end our trip! They did recompensate us by letting us off the food bill, but still...! Shocking!

Reviews.Title: “not bad”
Reviews.Author: Me137
Reviews.Content: Great view on the river was the best attidute of this hotel. Room was clean and of reasonable size with everything what I needed, but old. I did not like the bathroom which, although was clean, looked like bathroom on the ship, which is not pretty. If you like to sleep longer, it is not possible here, as the city airport is very close. In general it is a good value for money chain hotel in convenient localization for canary wharf or O2 but nothing special, just one of the ibis hotels.

Reviews.Title: “not recommended when DLR has engineering works!!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel itself is fine, a bit tatty and showing age, but its good enough and reasonably priced. The food in the restaurant was ok. Staff very helpful and friendly. Noisy corridors at night slightly hindered a peaceful night but thats expected in such a huge hotel. Check in was slow.

Reviews.Title: “Ok budget hotel for the ExCel or O2”
Reviews.Author: Chris H
Reviews.Content: New and clean, but basic and a bit sterile. Great location for the ExCel and ok for the O2 but don't stay here otherwise; the surrounding area is like a ghost town. Below average breakfast especially the quality of the sausages, but acceptable for a short stay. Nothing amazing but fine if you pay a cheap rate by booking in advance. However, £295 for 2 nights was ridiculous for this standard of hotel even when there is an event on the ExCel; luckily work were paying because I would never consider an ibis at these prices in a million years. Overall, the definition of 'average'.

Reviews.Title: “ON THE WAY TO WEMBLEY”
Reviews.Author: ortontrain Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 3 night break at the Ibis in the Docklands, ideal location away from the hussle and bussle of Central London, great transport links to and from the hotel, hotel near to Royal Victoria and Custom House stations on the DLR and close to Canning Town for the Jubilee Line. A clean hotel with a good stocked Bar and surprisingly good prices for a London Hotel. Breakfast was a breeze no hold ups give you plenty of time to have your Meal and for the cost good value for money. A good standard Hotel that gives value for all tastes and budgets.

Reviews.Title: “Service went down”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I saty in Ibis a lot but this time the food and drinks service were awful, my food was served completely burnt. when I showed this there was no response to change or address the situation. Again the breakfast food tasted worse, perhaps the cook was on holiday or something went bad in the kitchen. other aspects were fine.

Reviews.Title: “A Total Mismatch.....”
Reviews.Author: Anshul-Bhargava
Reviews.Content: I stayed during the World Travel mart at the resort and found that the resort is not only over priced but also hiding a lot of truth from the guest. 1. the rate give to us was over 180 Pounds per night where as the board right at the back reads 69 pounds per room for 2 people. When asked they said its the starting price and there rate was 180 pounds. Accepted and well taken. 2. The rate did not have breakfast in it. Surprised to the core. 3. There was one Still water bottle and one Bottle water provided for 2 people for a stay of 3 nights, and when we extended the stay for 2 more night there was still no water provided. Even after asking they said its there policy of 2 bottle per stay. 4. Keys never worked, even after keeping them absolutely separately from the mobile. Always had to go down to ask for the key. 5. The TV Channel were a bare minimum of 15-16 and all news channels, we were told that if we want satellite tv we have to pay 10 pounds which was a rip off as we did not find any new channels added to the score and only the movies were free after paying 10 pounds. 6. Rooms are extremely small, it think like 180 sq ft so there is no place to keep luggage. 7. The AC was not working and we were told that its winter and the heater is working now, the blankets were thick which are perfect for good winter but then we had to keep the windows open all the time to have fresh air. 8. Only Location is good right next to Excel this is it.

Reviews.Title: “What a view!”
Reviews.Author: kesfarnham
Reviews.Content: Managed to get a room for under £100 and I was so impressed. Outside my window just a few meters away was the river - it really made you feel like you were on holiday overlooking the flowing waters (even though I was only on a business trip). The restaurant food was nice - the menu not very extensive but tasty all the same, and the staff were very friendly. The room itself was one of the best I'd stayed in for the price. The bed had a memory foam mattress which I've never experienced before, and I will now go and buy one, it was wonderful. The bathroom was an enclosed large cubicle, and the shower inside was huge, and all very nice and clean. Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “not luxury but clean and tidy”
Reviews.Author: pooleamigos
Reviews.Content: Went recently to this hotel recently (as a family of 3) and found the place to be very clean and furnished to a good standard throughout. The rooms were fairly basic but comfortable. The hotel is easy to get to via the DLR (Customs House). The staff were very friendly and extremely helpful at all times and if we had an issue with anything it would be dealt with immediately. One word of advice - it is worth calling the hotel the week before you stay and try to get a room with a view of the dock. The only drawback with this is that the hotel is on the direct flight path for London City Airport, so beware of some noise from aircraft!! My daughter was delighted as she enjoyed watching the planes go past!! The local area is pleasant and is ideal for the Excell centre. Travelling time to central London was about 30 minutes. We did not use the restaurant at the hotel but it seemed to be busy at breakfast times. There is a convenience store over the road which we found useful. All in all a very nice stay and we would have no hesitation in returning.

Reviews.Title: “Exam Trip”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Really good hotel; Easy access from London City Airport, and so handy for the Docklands Light Railway. Took us 15minutes to Central London. Very busy, but staff still had time to deal with us in a calm and courteous manner. So all round thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “Simple and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff. Clean basic room. Bit far out of central London. But 30 mins on the DLR is better than some dirty little non chain 'hotels' in west London that charge more for a box room. Good price. Would stay again and recommend for friends. Be aware if something is on at the Excel the prices increase considerably, only value for money if you stay when an exhibition is not on.

Reviews.Title: “Great for excel”
Reviews.Author: arch_82
Reviews.Content: This is a perfect hotel for a business trip if you are at the excel centre. Rooms are clean, breakfast is big (basic but pleasant), and staff are friendly. Good storage for bags and other bits for after checkout. This is only really good if you are working/visiting at the Excel centre. Not good if you are visiting London- just too far to get back at night. Best to stop somewhere more central.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable for a trip to the O2 arena...”
Reviews.Author: Alice T
Reviews.Content: Stayed here after going to a concert at the O2 not the nearest but cheaper than all the hotels that I looked at and only two underground stops away from the arena with one change so very easy to get to and from . Staff were very polite and the room was very clean with a lovely view. Only advice bring your own biscuits haha!! Me and my friend were most disappointed that there were none available to buy at the hotel to go with our late night tea and all the shops were shut by this time :D . We didn't have the breakfast so can't really comment .

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but bad on overbooking”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel was ovebooked, so I was moved to Novotel for one night. They thought that they would to me a favor, but I had to move twice - which cost me a few hours and my wife was wailing all the time. If you want to be close to EXCEL convention center, THIS is the place to be...rooms are nice, standard IBIS as I always say.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, functional and cost effective!”
Reviews.Author: georgedubi
Reviews.Content: Ideally placed for the excel and O2 arena, great travel connections via DLR. Reception was busy with a moderate wait to book in. The room was compact but clean with an excellently equipped ensuit. Breakfast was £7.50 and buffet style. Kept us fed for the day. To sum up, economical and functional. Car parking also available although small and on a first come basis.

Reviews.Title: “With a good offer, good value”
Reviews.Author: Mark_Daemen
Reviews.Content: We had a very good offer on laterooms.com when booking 2 weeks beforehand. We came to London for a little site-seeing (enjoyed Brick Lane and Gehrard Richter in Tate Modern) and the NFL-game at Wembley. It's a half an hour trip away from the center in peak-time as DLR station is nearby. We parked the car in next door Novotelparking (15£/day). It's a typical chain hotel with Ibis standards. We had a clean room with convenient bed. Breakfast was also very good for what we paid when booking on laterooms. Would not go there for full price but with a good offer very ok.

Reviews.Title: “Basic”
Reviews.Author: Andrea P
Reviews.Content: I recently attended a conference in Docklands and was booked into the Ibis Excel. At £163 per night this was highly over priced. The receptionist spoke very little English and had difficulty reading English too, and at one point I was concerned that I would not be able to book in. My room was basic beyond belief, with a nylon carpet which was grubby, a bed more like a slab of concrete and brick like pillows. A plastic chair, not a single draw anywhere and the totally basic bathroom forming a plastic pod in the corner of the room. The toilet didn't always flush properly, the sink took ages to drain and the shower consisted of a shower head hooked on the wall. No products. Towels were old and slightly grey, no large bath towel, just two hand towels. No litter bin in the bedroom. TV was okay and there was tea and coffee in the room. Breakfast was okay, but not fabulous. Not good value for money, and did not provide any sense of comfort. Lots of people saying the same thing. At the conference the hotel was nicknamed Stalag 13!! A rip off. Came away with quite a few GED bug bites!!

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel we've ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: AnneW4
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in hotels the world over this is the worst we have ever had the misfortune to be booked into. The reception staff were very slow and some did not speak English at all well. We constantly had to have our room keys recoded and because of the staff this took ages which was very annoying. The bar was sometimes staffed by one person who was also the receptionist and running both at the same time. They had no bar experience and therefore no idea what they were doing. One of the staff didn't speak English at all. The hot breakfast was utterly tasteless and inedible and served on tiny plates. How you can make sausages and scrambled egg taste so bland is a mystery. Have the cold buffet which is better. The room we stayed in was very small and only functional for a very short stay. The shower was nice but there was no bath. A dangerous and annoying point is that at the doorway to the room there is a lip of about 2 inches which you will trip over each time you enter. It is well placed for the Excel Centre but I wouldn't stay there again when there are so many other better run hotels nearby. Avoid!!

Reviews.Title: “Disgracefull hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: For a hotel based beside a large exhabition center they should be used to high volumes of people. The Bar ran out of glasses on both nights they advertise a 24 hour food service but don't ask for anything after 12. staff we ploding about like the did not want to be there. The bed mattressess were thin and unconfirtable, we booked a double room but were given a twin and told there were no doubles available.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: HectorFromBerne
Reviews.Content: A good value hotel in a very pleasant environment - the Docklands are attractive, and the DLR gives good access to the city and to the Stratford/Leyton area, and onwards to the main underground network. Location good, facilities standard Ibis: clean and functional. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money, nice location close to city and airport”
Reviews.Author: paulhaych
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night with a friend as we had a flight from London City Airport early the next morning. We paid €41 for a twin room for one night. The hotel was modern and clean and the location was excellent and the staff were all very friendly. The room was spacious, modern and clean and came with LCD TV, Kettle with tea/coffee and wifi was available to purchase. The hotel was very close to the airport which was perfect for us and only a short DLR and tube ride from the city. Check In wasn't until 2pm but we arrived at 11am and we were able to check in early. There is also a 24 hour bar which serves hot food/ snacks and was reasonably priced. The lounge area was also very modern and comfortable. There are also 3 lifts in the hotel. Overall I had a pleasant experience at this hotel and will stay here again the next time i visit London.

Reviews.Title: “IBIS Excel, London Docklands”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Whilst this is a well located hotel next to The Excel Centre in London, in the IBIS group, it is very busy and therefore service is less than I have come to expect with IBIS. My room was the usual IBIS size and had the usual facilities, but the cleanliness was below par with a distinct lack of supervision of room staff (carpet was not cleaned in the entire 5 day stay). The breakfast buffet was clearly understaffed, with food items continually running out and several being unavailable for several days at all. The reception area was small and noisy, and the check in was very slow. And the keys failed on 2 days, necessitating a return to reception from the 7th floor to rectify the problem. I feel the hotel needs to increase the staff at peak times, to bring this hotel up to the standard one expects of IBIS.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Although there were not toiletries in the bathroom, everything was perfect. The staff were very friendly and the hotel is just a short walk from Royal Victoria DLR Station. There are two shops close to the hotel and so I am sure that you could buy anything that you needed in one of them.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Modern in a quiet location”
Reviews.Author: cgandps
Reviews.Content: Suberb location, conveniently located a couple of minutes walk from the DLR line. Very easy to access central London. Our room had a great view overlooking the river. Parking is shared with the hotel next door and costs £15 a night. We left the car parked up, as it wasn't clear how we could get it out without paying twice. Overall service in the hotel was good. We needed extra pillows, as 1 thin one each wasn't sufficient. They were quick to help, and bring us more. Breakfast buffet available until 10am both hot and continental. I recommend going early, as the negative point I have is the staff wouldn't replenish hot items after 9:30. I think they could have been more accommodating with this. We would definately go back though, as the location is great.

Reviews.Title: “2* experience”
Reviews.Author: NicoletaG
Reviews.Content: One of the poor choices for visiting London. Far from the center (it takes about 1 hour and switching from DLR to the tube or bus) the Ibis does not live up to the International standards of a 3* hotel. The bathrooms are built in (oddly I might add) with the shower cabin, otherwise pretty good size showers, but since this is a close by the Thames river hotel you can smell it though the drains. Of course the fact that the housekeeping is not doing their job helps a lot too. And not that I didn't announce the front desk about it, because I did, twice, and that's how many times in a week the room got cleaned. Except that, I did get the bed folded. And that's that. For those travelling from outside of UK no matter what you are told, watch out for the payments done. The pre-authorisation in UK will block the money in the account and the seller is allowed to take those at any point within the 30 days. So unless you want to get double charged I strongly suggest you pay when you get there. Our luck was that one of the managers did know that had happened in other cases with visitors from outside of UK and did not charge us twice (Selene thank you - I have to say she was the only one trained for the job, the other front desk attenders knew only the speech to be told). The closet is small and oddly shaped as well, barely room to put clothes for a couple of people staying in for a few days. The noise level is ok, excepting the planes - watch out the London City Airport is too close and has quite a bit of traffic. The positioning of the room may help some but not too much. Overall it was an overpriced hotel for the services rendered. The Breakfast is expensive good thing it's not included, you can manage to eat somewhere else or grab a sandwich on the way. Two supermarkets are close by, Nisa and Spar, strongly suggest the Spar which is further but cheaper plus they do have better offers. Don't forget to get a plug adaptor, UK's are different then the rest of the European's.

Reviews.Title: “Ibis does good again!”
Reviews.Author: PCEFLECFLN
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here 4 times now. This time I stayed with my two 14yr olds. As always the reception we received upon arriving was friendly and warm. The reception area was clean, brightly lit and the check in was quick with only a brief wait. My room was very clean as was the bathroom. The restaurant provided a very good breakfast each morning and we ate in the restaurant on the third evening and found the service quick and good value for money. This is not a luxury hotel but if you are looking for somewhere with good transport links to the city, friendly service, clean and welcoming this would be a great place to try.

Reviews.Title: “Nice budget accomodation in the Docklands”
Reviews.Author: NiclasAa
Reviews.Content: The hotel shares a rather huge building just of the river Thames, next to ExCel, with the Novotel Hotel. Probably not that weird considering they are both Accor Hotels and are aimed at different kinds og guests, with Ibis offering no frills, budget accomodation. The hotel is very easy to find from the nearby DLR station. When I entered the lobby I was met by quite a lot of noice from the bar which is located in the same area and was very crowded this evening. The line to the reception desk wasn't very long and in no time I was greeted by a smiling, friendly staff member who quickly had every sorted and handed me my keycard for my 3rd floor room. The room was very clean and had a clean, well sized bathroom with quite a big shower. The bed was comfortable and was big enough for two adults as well. The room also had a desk which was ideal for your laptop and doing a bit of work or planning your next day in the metropol. WiFi is available and there was a 24 hours package on offer, which included some extras as well, that will set you back 9.99 GBP. You can also get a 24 hour access directly on your laptop from Orange for 9.90 EUR without the extras. WiFi worked well in my room and the speed was very good andc even worked well for streaming movies. The TV in the room was quite small and had very few channels on it, so if you need lots of in room entertainment you should either bring a USB receiver for your laptop, buy the Wifi + extras package or choose a different hotel. The room had one window, which can be opened a fair bit. The room also had air condition which worked very well. The hotel i situated close to London City Airport and during the day there can be some noice from planes flying low above the hotel. I never heard any noice during night or early morning and with the window closed the noise level was indeed very acceptable. All in I had a very nice stay. Staff was friendly throughout my stay and facilities were what you'd expect of a reasonable budget hotel. It is the perfect spot for going to ExCel, only 200-300 meters from the hotels entrance. The locations is also good if you want some good but not too expensive and too crammed accomodation for a visit to London. DLR will take you to central London and to Underground stations in 10-15 minutes. I wouldn't mind staying here again if I need accomodation in east London or just need some low cost accomodation for my next London stay.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeIII
Reviews.Content: This was the first time I've ever stayed at a so-called 'budget' hotel and I have to say I was very impressed. The public areas were very clean and kept tidy, the rooms were small but adequate and again very clean. I would certainly have no hesitation in staying here again - if necessary! I have to say there is nothing to do near-by but I suppose it is convienient for those wishing to travel into central London. We were staying as a friend was having their birthday celebration in the Fox@excel a minutes walk away - so the location was perfect for us. All in all a good experience staying here and I would certainly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Trip to London Excel”
Reviews.Author: MarcusMis Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: An unusual Hotel, with a pleasant location, albeit in the docklands area of London. This hotel is based at the core of another of the Accor chain hotels, the other higher level one has the exterior views over the Excel dock waters, hence the additional cost of rooms. The DLR is only a short walk away, so is good for public transport access to the UK Capital. Reception in the Ibis Excel was a little unreliable, we stayed there for a total of 4 days, on two bookings, but getting the staff to understand the fact that these were consecutive, and that I had actually booked breakfast too was almost impossible, needing daily maintenance with them. The rooms are large, but with a small version of the modern style of bathroom/toilet combo - this could have been larger, as there was some wasted space in the room. The breakfast was a lowish level, the scrambled egg had virtually no taste. Given the location, they probably have a captive audience for this, I'd certainly not pay full price for their breakfast, as with most IBIS, they want just too much. Overall we found it not a bad hotel and will stay there again, but I still have no invoice for my stay, as when booking out I was told I had a two day booking nothing more, and had had enough of explanations to the young staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: manujames
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean and fairly modern. Rooms were great, plenty of space. Bathrooms especially clean and modern. Reception staff helpful and friendly. Amazing value for money. Location just 5mins walk from the DLR so tubes into London simple. Hotel overlooks the water so nice views. Only one small gripe was the breakfast was not up to the same standard as the rest of the hotel. More choices and healthy options required please. Other than that it was fine. Will definitely use again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay, easy to reach”
Reviews.Author: iloveswitzerland0
Reviews.Content: Pot luck late booking for myself, daughter and grandson. Very easy to find via Docklands Light Railway, Bank, change at Canning Town, off at Excel. 5 minute walk across lovely concourse to hotel. Good reception, room was excellent, sofa bed that was a real sofa bed, comfortable. Nice bathroom. Excellent buffet breakfast the next morning. One of our better London stays. Would not hesitate to recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Ibis docklands”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: No fuss, non intrusive, friendly and in the main efficient staff. Rooms are clean and cater for most requirements. Easy access to local bus and rail services. A number of local restaurants. Pleasant and interesting views over the docklands and to some of Londons' landmarks. Even enjoyed the aircraft flying into London City Airport.

Reviews.Title: “What you would expect for the money”
Reviews.Author: ArnoldSurrey
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for one night when attending a Neil Diamond concert at the O2. It's "ok". Pluses= fast efficient check in, Clean room. TV plus remote that worked! Very near to transport links. Area quiet (at the time we stayed) Minuses= no one running the bar (gave up and went elsewhere hence rating) Bed rather hard. Very few flat hard pillows. A bit of a wait to check out. Having said all that - it was a reasonable rate for London but be aware it's a bit of a trek if you want the London highlights.

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Maginot26
Reviews.Content: Ease to get to Very good accessibility by car, no need to go on M25 if travelling from M11! Check-in Quick and efficient Room On 6th floor, room facing court yard. Was very basic, towels no bigger than hand towels. If staying in Ibis again will have to bring own towels. No bath in room, although shower was a good size and strong water flow. Single bar of soap and liquid soap in shower for the extent of toiletries. Bed comfortable and good size. Nice sized flat screen tv above bed. Walls thin and noise easily audible. Breakfast Very poor breakfast, sausage, scrambled egg, sausages and beans the extent of cooked breakfast. Toaster broken, but the only one in the hotel, so no toast. Very disappointing! Only saving grace was free newspapers, mail, times, independent etc and nice coffee machine. Amenities Parking is available at the Novotel next door. Remember to get ticket validated at reception and then take to Novotel to pay £15 instead of £30 for non guests having an overnight stay. Tube DLR is across the road from the hotel, however works were going on and so an expensive taxi ride to and from centre of London. We paid £25 for one way journey to Covent Garden. Bar and restaurant is also available at the hotel. Internet is available for a fee. Hotel Generally an okay 3* hotel if you can get a good price and tube is working. Staff are friendly and efficient and rooms were clean. However one bugbear, was the fact someone ordered food in their room the night before, they left their food out in the corridor and this was still not removed until 11am the following day and this made the corridor smell.

Reviews.Title: “Very cheap but too far away”
Reviews.Author: flyingscot1982
Reviews.Content: Got a good deal on this hotel. Normailly try and stay fairly central but thought we'd give this a try. Extremely basic hotel and very little in the way of amenities in the room. Had to ask for a hairdrier but would have been better getting an asthmatic to blow on year it was so rubbish. Also, realised there was no iron in room so asked for one but told we had to go to small room on one of the other floor. Really inconvenient and iron was rubbish - for being a business hotel it doesn't really cater for business people who i'd assume would want to iron shirts etc. Last - as we were on london on holiday Docklands was just too far away from the centre. It took best part of an hour to get into london every day and the same home which curtailed our enjoyment a little. Also, no DLR service at weekends so had to get bus to nearest tube station. This hotel is fine if you just want somewhere clean and very basic to stay if you're in the area on business but i definately wouldn't recommend for holidays.

Reviews.Title: “Ibis London Excel-Docklands”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Don't expect much from a hotel like this, quick stop over for an early Monday morning flight. However, there are two things which are important - comfortable bed and decent shower. Bed had a plastic undersheet and was really uncomfortable Shower was running hot and cold

Reviews.Title: “stay in london”
Reviews.Author: DouganNewcastle Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and welcoming. Although I waited twenty five minutes at the reception on arrival before someone came to assist me and despite two workers passing by , both choose to ask me if they could be of any assistance. The DLR was cancelled the weekend that I arrived so my journey from central London was a nightmare ( taking two hours in total) The hotel states it is near to O2 but actually a cab cost me £18 to get there, and £22 to return after the event.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal For O2”
Reviews.Author: LadyJayneG
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel as a last minute choice for a trip to the o2. Although not ideal if you're thinking of doing the typical tourism stuff in central London, its absolutely great if your itinary revolves around something happening at the o2. Yes its a budget hotel but its clean, the bed was really comfortable and the shower was great. I wouldnt hesitate to recommend it to anyone looking to book something in that part of London. One downside was that on the weekend we visited, several DLR stations were closed for engineering work which meant replacement buses. Not great on the hottest weekend of the year! My guess would be that as the Olympics approach, that engineering work will become more and more frequent so if buses arent your thing, it might be worth investigation before you book this location.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't recommend it”
Reviews.Author: 1elou
Reviews.Content: I stayed only one night for a weekend leisure trip at London and wanted something good but not overpriced. Maybe the service was fair for the price but honestly it was the worst hotel choice I have ever made and I wouldn't suggest it. First of all the location is not convenient if you want to do some sightseeing, especially due to maintenance works to DLR at weekends (the underground line that serves this hotel) that means a lot of discomfort regarding transportation. Second, a really bad behavior was about an offer that they refused to provide. In the hotel website there is the statement 'AS AN ISIC CARDHOLDER YOU WILL RECEIVE A FREE BREAKFAST AT ibis' but when I asked they refused. About the room, the view was a wall. Regarding the bathroom amenities, there was only one bath towel and no hand towel. When I called the reception to provide me one towel, they asked me to go downstairs to the reception and collect them myself! In the room there is no hairdryer, not even a cheap basic one, and the situation was the same, go and collect from the reception if you want to use! The design was really really basic, not to say bad. And finally no slippers provided and the carpet didn't look clean at all! That was completely bad! To conclude even if you are on a budget try a hotel that at least would be closer to the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient comfort”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: For a hotel in this class the Ibis London Excel-Docklands was just what we required. Located near London City airport, the hotel provided comfortable accommodation, excellent service, and is close to the Docklands Light Railway, providing easy access to other parts of London. Car parking is available next door. If you are flying out of London City airport, this hotel is very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “BIG MONEY FOR NOTHING!”
Reviews.Author: PearlC
Reviews.Content: I recently attended a business meeting and stayed at IBIS docklands.The hotel was a big disappointment. I paid £153 for one night, there was no hairdryer, no shower cap and no breakfast. I did not like the area and felt very uneasy walking from DLR back to the hotel, therefore I would not reccommnend this hotel to females travelling alone!

Reviews.Title: “good and bad”
Reviews.Author: sparkly1968
Reviews.Content: hotel is nice and fairly easy to find.reception staff nice and friendly.rooms ok,basic not very big wouldnt want to stay here longer than a few nights,beds not that comfy.breakfast is buffet with a variety of different foods bacon,egg etc and cereals and toast was fair to good.ate evening meal twice first night good service good food good took about 15mins to arrive great second night awful,after being told on arrival that there was a 45min wait thought long but ok had little choice to go anywhere else,over 1hr 30mins later an with no explanation as to why,i had to go and ask myself to which i was told it will be another 15mins and that they would comp the meal,i should think so as well.last day decided to eat at the bar was short changed,they said they would look at the cameras and check till but was then told couldnt check cameras till tues,i was leaving soon so left them my details,will wait and see if they get back.got the feeling i wasnt believed and after paying £500+ for 2 rooms for 2nights i think trying to get a free sandwich is a joke. one more thing hotel has room service wasnt any when i was there!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here - bad hotel and location. Only the price was acceptable”
Reviews.Author: JosephKnock
Reviews.Content: Don't stay here unless you really need to. It is a good 30-40 minute trip (you need to take the tube and the light rail) into London. For a few $$$ more pay to stay somewhere close to the action. The area also had that "unfriendly" vibe about it when we travelled back on the tube in the evenings. Rooms were ok, but had a dormitory feel for what was advertised as a 3 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, great location, and great customer service”
Reviews.Author: djohnba
Reviews.Content: The Ibis London Excel at Docklands is a clean and very reliable hotel. It is affordable and comfortable although basic. Please do not expect a fancy 4 or 5 star accommodation, but what you will get is a good place to rest in a clean, quiet, and reliable accommodation. We stayed in a triple for a week (April 27- May 5, 2011) and had NO REGRETS. The front desk staff is very accommodating and tentative. We did have one concern with a smell from the bathroom shower drain, but they were attentive to my concerns and took care of the problem. I stayed with two teenagers (my son and niece) and they were comfortable. I paid for the movie and internet package for a few nights and we were satisfied with that. We did not have the breakfast so I cannot comment on that. At night the bar area is lively so there is a social area for adults downstairs. The location of this hotel is close to the DLR station (less than 6 minutes walk from the hotel). To get to central London you can take the DLR straight to the Tower Hill stop which is near some of the attractions or you can take the DLR and then switch to another line to get anywhere in central London. It is less than 20 minutes into central London. I highly recommend this hotel if you do not want to spend all of your holiday money on a fancy hotel, but still want a clean, comfortable and very decent place to stay. You really cannot expect more from a budget hotel. Later on in our trip (May 9-11) we stayed at another hotel in central London (in the Earls Court area) and it was awful. I hate to say this but there are some very tired hotels in central London that are very overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, Cheerful and well worth the trip”
Reviews.Author: ChezzaLeach
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic value for money. The rooms are basic but extremely clean and quiet. The staff were exceptionally polite and courteous and the bar is open until late. Breakfast was fantastic with lots of choice and hot! This hotel is well worth stayin at it is 5 mins away from the DLR and one stop away from the jubilee line.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Customer Service - NEVER AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: Lee267
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner stayed at this hotel for a one night stay simply because it was close to the 02 arena, the room was very BASIC but was clean. On arrival as we were checking in we were asked if we wanted to have breakfast and if we would like to pay now which we did it was £15 pounds and we paid in cash. We later changed our minds about having the breakfast as we had to leave earlier then expected and therefore we were no longer going to stay for the breakfast and asked for the £15 to be refunded. We were told by reception there was no record on there system that we had paid the £15 and we were asked who checked us in. We told them it was the young girl with long brown hair and she had even given us change, they still said there was no record of the payment in which case she may have pocketed our cash. We then asked to speak to a manager to which we were told there was no manager on site in the hotel and they are unable to refund us as they cannot get in contact with the member of staff that had checked us in. We were given an email address for he manager and we checked out £15 pounds lighter. Food - Ordered a pizza from the bar which was awful and a drink which tasted as if it had past its date. There is one local shop opposite the hotel which is extremely over priced. Parking - This hotel shares its car park with the hotel next door the Novel, on arrival there was an issue with the gate and we had to wait while it operated a one in one out service. Once you check out of the Ibis you have to go to the 1st floor of the hotel next door to pay the £15 pounds overnight fee. Overall the room being clean is the only plus , room is pretty tiny and there is no room service. The front desk take a long time to grasp anything you say and to take money and have no record of it seems ridiculous.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: clairedelune78
Reviews.Content: great location since it is 100 metres from the london excel.we arrived early around ten a.m and there was no room available so we had to wait untill 14p.m. Great view What you would expect from the room of a budget hotel. The great thing is that when you are in the room you have the feelling of floating...... AMAZING. Close to tower hill only 7 minutes by the DLR.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Hotel but rooms looking a little tired”
Reviews.Author: Wookie32 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location and value however the rooms are starting to look a little tired but for short stays this is ok. Staff were friendly and helpful but a little slow on check in. Bar prices were very good for London would recommend for short stays

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for money, for a budget hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Kelseyrose
Reviews.Content: We chose the Ibis for its closeness to Excel as we were visiting the Dive Show. The parking was onsite and secure, great value at £15. The room was the size you would expect for a budget hotel, but clean, and more pillows and towels were provided promptly on request. There was a slight delay checking in as the receptionist couldn't find our booking due to a typing error in the name, however the receptionist was very polite, and helpful. The late breakfast was a good idea (it was a Sunday), due to previous reviews we didn't expect much, however the breakfast was very good, branded mini boxes of cereals, breads,pastries,juice, branded bio yogurts and drinks,cheese, ham also scrambled eggs/beans etc, which was very good value for the advertised continental breakfast, it was all self service. We would happily use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms shame about the awful customer service”
Reviews.Author: UKandbeyond
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in a good few hotels and have never experienced such awful customer service. The first room we were given was in the middle of their 'light refurbishment' which meant there would be banging in the room next door to us until 9pm and strong paint smells. We went to change rooms and discovered we had been given a twin room, rather than a double. With a unhelpful attitude throughout and trying to tell us we'd booked a twin we eventually got a decent room on the third time. They made a big deal about me asking to not be in a room where there was hammering against the wall. We also overheard them struggling to find us a room as the hotel had been "overbooked". I am sure this isn't a reflection of the Ibis chain but I would be very reluctant to stay in one again.

Reviews.Title: “stay ruined by noise at night and disappointing evening meal”
Reviews.Author: isabel37
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights 2nd to 4th April 2011 in room 721. The room was clean and functional for a budget hotel, although I half expected the bathroom to go into orbit due to the noise each time the toilet was flushed. Would have liked hand towels as well as the rather thin towel supplied per person. But overall the room was ok and had a very pleasant view. Breakfast was fine, but the one evening meal we had was very disappointing. For example, my husband ordered a 'beer battered fish' dish, and a rather sad looking 'breaded fish' (which reminded us of fish bought in bulk in a supermarket) was presented to him. He explained this was not as ordered and a very willing waitress replaced it - with another albeit more presentable 'breaded fish'. He gave up. The staff were overall obviously anxious to please, but there was some difficulty with communication - none of the staff appearing to have english as a first language. However, any disappointment with the evening meal was nothing compared to the noise experienced at night. Noise starting in the early hours of sunday (2-3am) included loud laughter, running along corridors, doors banging and toilets flushing and appeared to come, not only from our floor, but from above. We put up with the disturbance putting it down to saturday night festivities. However, the following night the noises started again and this time at about midnight . The noise definately being in the main directly above us. We endured until about 1.30 am when I rang reception in desperation - the gentleman on duty was extremely polite and said he would investigate - and the noise, although not ceasing completely, became bearable after about 20 mins. Two disturbed nights for two pensioners did spoil our stay at the hotel, and therefore our long awaited trip to London to see Peter Kay at the 02 on the saturday night. I look forward to the Manager's comments.

Reviews.Title: “Great as a base for exploring and the o2”
Reviews.Author: olibill1982
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights in march. Had tickets to see peter kay at the o2. On arrival we were told that we couldnt check in until 2pm. They offered to store our baggage free of charge. We sat in the bar as it was 13.00pm. Service was friendly and efficent. whilst waiting we glanced at the food menu, it appeared reasonably priced and the selection was varied. The main areas were clean and well maintained. The alcohol prices were reasonable aswell. Our room was on the 4th floor and right at the end 449. It was clean and comfortable. The bathroom is more of a wetroom. The rooms are budget, but like i say they were clean and comfy. Things like hairdryers are available on request. But tea and coffee are supplied and rooms made up daily. The towels are small and only one pillow is provided. However i am sure if we had asked they would have offered us some more, but we didnt see the need. They are refurbing between the hours of 9 and 5, but we werent there and there was no evidence to show anything was happening, apart from banging on the first morning at 1030am. The hotel had a lot of business people from the excel centre and school children from abroad. Niether caused us any bother at all. The hotel itself was located about 2mins from the royal victoria stop on the DLR. We bought a day travel card at 8 pounds each and changed at canning town for the tube. Canning town is one stop from Royal Victoria and One stop from the o2. We went into london on both days and it took s about 20 to 30 mins depending on were we were heading. We ate at the o2 on both nights as it has a good selection of bars and resturants. We had no trouble getting about and saw lots of sights. The tube is being upgraded at the weekends so be mindful of this. The bus replacements are frequent but not as quick as the tube. Your travel card will be valid on these. London as usual is pricey but a good getaway. AS for the ibis its a great hotel. Breakfast was buffet style and varied in its selection. The bottom line is i travel frequently and know you go were you can afford. Ibis isnt glitzy or glamourous but it serves its purpose well as a base. If you want comfort and some where to rest your weary feet go here. If you want the added extras go elsewhere. I will use this hotel again and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Docklands”
Reviews.Author: Alison1801 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Perfectly adequate for budget accommodaiton at ExCeL. Predictably Ibis but this has a bar and does food. Nothing else to add, but the system is requiring 200 characters which is quite hard to do when nothing else to say!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money review”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: the !00 pound per night was not good value, this should have cost about 60 pound sterling otherwise good facility, public transport is a challenge from the location but other wise a good quiet place to stay and away from the hussle and bussle of down town hotels. there is evan a wonderful place to walk around.its not advertised. even the exhibition groumds are not indiacted in the advert for the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Decent value/experience for the money”
Reviews.Author: GMK1954
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Ibis was a decent value for the money. We stayed 5 nights. It's a bit far from central London, so access to nightlife was a little limited. The DLR was a 5 min walk and easy to find. Our room was clean, size was about what we expected (not overly large), and the bathroom was not too small. The shower design was one where water tended to collect on the bathroom floor, unfortunately (standing, no bathtub). No major problems with hearing noises from upstairs/other rooms. Small TV had a few UK channels and 1/2 channels from other European nations. The front desk could have been a little more helpful - they did not seem very interested when we showed up to check in, and initially tried to tell us that our stay did not include breakfast (which in fact we did pay for when we booked the room - they later caught their mistake). No such problems at check out. There was a medium-sized supermarket out front which was very convenient and open till fairly late. Other than a few other hotels and the Excel center, there didn't seem to be much else out here. The breakfast was good and had a lot of different foodstuffs... unfortunately it was the same food everyday! With the variety though, it wasn't that bad. One busy day though the coffee seemed to run out, we couldn't find any ketchup, and the staff seemed slightly overwhelmed. We did eat dinner once and although it wasn't cheap, it was quite tasty. The signs for breakfast said 6am to whenever, but this was misleading. On our last day we had to catch an early AM flight and when we went down at 6... the restaurant area was not setup. The staff did quickly bring us a few small items, but obviously it was not what I expected. Overall nothing exceptional, but a slightly better than average experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good option”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I attended a meeting at the UEL and this was a convenient option. Good quality for the price. The room is clean and wide enough, bathroom well enough. Breakfast quite good for the price. A bit too much flow of people, but still ok. It takes time to reach from downtown, and there are not much options once you are there for dinner or drinks (Canary Wharf is the best one). Easy to make some jogging (by the riverside and some path here and there).

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Good”
Reviews.Author: CelticPathfinder
Reviews.Content: Booked IBIS just for one night as I wanted to be near the Excel centre. Got a great deal of around £60 B & B. Room was large , clean and comfortable and the bathroom large with a good walk in shower. Hotel looks pretty new. Short walk to the DLR Royal Victoria station. Had dinner in a good chinese restaurant just 3 mins walk from the hotel. It is a shame that IBIS hotels in the UK do not provide free wifi to guests. Breakfast was a bit chaotic with one coffee machine out of action and every time I got up from my table to get something from the buffet someone else had sat down at my place or the staff had cleared my plates away before I had finished. Overall good value for money and location in Victoria Dock

Reviews.Title: “overall Nice. Good location and views. reasonable price too.”
Reviews.Author: t2t_time2travel
Reviews.Content: Nice simple hotel. -Staff were average though and did lack knowledge of local surroundings. great restaurants within 5mins walk and small stores for food. Hotel restaurant has limited options, not very vegetarian friendly. room was simple, stylish and clean :) two minutes walk from royal victoria station, DRL line. shame tubes were expensive as its in zone 5 though. Would still recommend this hotel. enjoyed our 2nights there but is somewhere for a good weekend or nights sleep, not enough facilities for a long stay.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
